text: Good food friendly and fast service! Love that they have a lot of variety on their menu and that they deliver...so no matter what mood I'm in I can find something I want on their menu plus the convenience of delivery! Got chicken fingers with fries, garlic knots and a slice of cheese cake for later and it totally hit the spot.

Completely disgusting! I ordered the Philly cheese steak sub and my husband ordered the meatball sub. My sub was very dry, the meat was tasteless and tough. My husband on had meat balls and marinara sauce on his sub no cheese at all which usually comes on a meatball sub. The fries were tiny and appeared to be refrozen then baked. This is the worst restaurant I have ordered take out from since I moved to Vegas! How can you ruin a sub? I mean really its sandwich! Come on you guys have to do a better job with your menu.
I highly recommend this place!! The white pizza was very good!! Good atmosphere and friendly service!! Francisco was very helpful and friendly!!

Whoo hoo!!!!!    VEGAN PIZZA AND ENTREES :)    

Vegan pizza with Daiya cheese and up to 3 veggies, vegan baked zita with Daiya, vegan calzone.  Very nice, friendly and knowledgeable counterhelp.

Only drawback is they don't offer vegan pizza by the slice.  Wish they would do so as well as offering "meat" options such as vegan pepperoni, chicken etc.  

I got a small (8" 4 slice) green pepper olives and mushrooms.  It only took about 10 minutes to bake it.  It smelled wonderful on the drive home; tasted wonderful when I ate it. Sauce is not an overwhelming tomatoey taste which is great, as I can't stand tomatoes.

Would be nice i they could develop a vegan dessert (cannolli or cheesecake).  I will be back.

This place is awesome, i didn't even care that it was delivered late cause they're under staff, but the food was hot when delivered, the serving was more than i expected and it taste so good. And thank you for letting me know that it's gonna be late delivery (which i understand) unlike other places that doesn't care. 

So keep it up and for sure i will order here again. Thank you again!
Very good service. Little bit out of the way. Great prices for the quantity of food served. Chessy garlic bread very good. Thick crust pizza good.

Came after graduation with a huge party of people and staff was amazing. We were taken care of, food came out in a timely manner, and best of all delicious vegan options. We got vegan garlic knots and vegan pizza.

I'm going to give this place a solid 4 stars. I ordered delivery. They told me 45 mins, it actually came in about 30 mins I ordered a large pizza cooked well done and crispy, which they did. I also ordered wings, with hot sauce on the side, which they also did. i got what i asked and paid for, so i am happy with that. Food was pretty good. It didn't blow me away, that almost never happens in Vegas due to the mostly non-discerning folks who live here. Most people here are really into chains, which personally i despise. therefore there's not a whole lot of collective demand for stuff to be exceptional here. but it's all good. i will probably order from here again.

The pizza had a weird aftertaste,when I attempted to get my money back for the uneaten portion,the cook? Told me no one else complained,even going so far to ask a patron in the restaurant if there was anything wrong with her pizza! I pointed out none of this mattered,concerning the taste of my pizza,and I just wanted my money back,he told they already made it and delivered it,so that was that. Very unprofessional and rude!!
I have ordered from this place several times.  Each time the delivery was quick and the food was great!  Definitely recommend!

The food was delivered over an hour and half after I placed the order. I called the restaurant twice and explained my kids needed to go to bed, only an apology was offered. The restaurant blamed the driver and suggested the food was just waiting to be picked up. Hmmm doesn't sound fresh after an hour and a half. The fee and tip had already been added to my order. I will not order from this restaurant again. I order at 630pm pizza arrive at 753pm. 

In all fairness the pizza was flavorful and a nice change from other local establishments. Salad was warm, garlic knots were burnt, pizza was good.

I don't understand iv been so excited to come for the vegan options I walk in told the guy we're excited for the vegan options and he says" oh great more vegans" he then starts to tell me the specials I asked if there was vegan meats and he looked at my like I was a damn idiot.. and smirked and said no. Only daiya cheese.:never coming back

Always skeptical about new vegan places, but was extremely happy....  Our server was beyond friendly, helpful, and attentive... 

We loved the pizza and the pasta.... 2 dishes had enough to share, and enough leftovers...  Definitely will come again soon!

The food was good and the service was genuine and thorough. For our daughter, it's hard to find a place that has gluten-free crust (without eggs) and vegan cheese, let alone such a combination that tastes good to her. She loved it!

I ordered once for a delivery and I was shocked how fast they are the food was so good I got a vegan pizza and a vegan brownie both were yummy. So I decided to in and check the place out. The guy that works there idk his name is so nice and you can tell he cares a lot about his customers. I tried to order a vegan burger they didn't have any *bummer*  . I know you could tell my face was blanked because I didn't know what to get but the guy offered to make me a vegan pasta that I didn't even see on the menu. I agreed to it and it was so good I was so full and satisfied. He went out of his way to make sure I had a great lunch that fit with my eating choices. I would go there again any time I do live 10min away

For the price and the fact that they delivered in the time stated was a great start.  To add to the value, I could get a small pizza since my husband prefers pasta and I hate that I have to order at least a 12" from other places and I throw half of it away.  All this being said, the food was very good and I would totally order from here again!!!

My family and I made this am every other Friday staple . we have had friends who are now regulars. Why you may ask? Well there pizza is incredible! The taste is great and ingredients are perfection! Its made to order and even taste good re heated the next day! The staff there is friendly and owner makes an effort to remember you and make conversation! When you walk in the atmosphere is cozy! They have spicy buffalo chicken breast that are really great and I eat those every time! There ranch is where its at, fresh, rich and delicious! Overall this is my favorite pizza joint in Las Vegas !

Their vegan pizza is amazing!! I've been on the hunt to find a delicious, dairy-free pizza with a great crust and plenty of fresh toppings. For Vegas, Pizza Company is it! Although it's not on the menu, they do offer fresh basil  This place doesn't skimp out on their toppings either  My only regret from this place is that I didn't get the name of the worker who was there when I picked up my pizza. He informed me that they sometimes make specialty desserts like Vegan Tiramisu, and they sell out quick when they do. He also let me sample their Vegan Ricotta which is not on the menu and is a special request. It was delicious! This place is a great option for Vegans, people with dairy intolerance and or allergies like myself, and anyone who wants to taste something new. My boyfriend who can eat dairy with no problem even liked my vegan pizza. Pizza Company also offers vegan ranch and it was absolutely delicious! My boyfriend and I agreed that the taste was better to us than normal ranch; however, it doesn't have the same consistency. Who cares about that when the flavor is so good! Thank you Pizza Company and the gentleman that gave me a very memorable experience. I will definitely be coming back again!
Hands down my favorite pizza joint. They really cater to vegans. Their in house made cashew ricotta "cheese" is amazeballs. Thanks guys.

the owner Joey is a great guy as it gets! He takes pride in his ingredients and recipes! does what he can to charge good prices for good quality recipes! I haven't said no to almost anything there! the pizza seriously is new york style using the grande cheese! his sandwiches are excellent! still haven't had a chance to try his pasta since i always eat it at home haha, but i bet its great! Love his garlic knots as well! Its worth checking out and going back over and over!

This is the WORST pizza ever!!! It gave my grandmother food poisoning and she had to be taken to the hospital.  These people NEVER getting business from us again and I'm going to tell people NOT to eat. They wouldn't even give us a refund.
Joel is an amazing restaurant owner and does a great job. Pizza is always hot, fresh, and delicious!

I've dropped into The Pizza Company from time to time over the last year or two - always a wonderful experience.  I met a friend of mine here for lunch today.  I always enjoy my visits here, and marvel at the fact it isn't totally packed in here.  The owner is always there, and is always friendly and attentive.  They have a rockin' thin crust pizza here, that is among the best in Vegas, and their wings ARE THE BEST I've had in Vegas.  This is a small place, only 6 or 7 tables, but the atmosphere is very comfortable.  As a few of the tips say, you can subscribe to their text alerts and receive specials and promotions via text.  That's what I took advantage of today -  their Dinner for 2 (even though it was lunch): A large 2-topping pizza, 6 wings, and 6 garlic knots for $14.99 - this is a limited-time special, but they offer similar specials via text alert all the time.  The only minus is that I wish they offered fountain drinks instead of (or along with) canned and bottled drinks.  If this place was more convenient for me, I would be here all the time.  At any rate, it is well worth a drive across town to enjoy their food!

Using Eat24 we just received and ate our first "Delivery" from Pizza Company on Sunset, 89119.
The whole family is sitting around with huge bellies and bulging eyes. The food was wonderful. Ordering on line through Eat24 was easy. There were places to ask for extras and change pasta. Our order arrived within the time period provided. Everything was hot and plentiful. 

#1 16" Margarita Pizza with Pepperoni. We asked for well done. That is how it came with a topping of fresh mozzarella and basil. Luscious, with drippy cheese, and great spices.

#2 Sausage and Peppers.  The sausages had been saute'd prior to being put with the peppers and onions. They were sliced thin. Each fork full was sausage, peppers (red and green bell) and some onion. It was wonderful. Mixed in was Ziti and a great "juice" or sauce that was light and not "tomatoey".

#3 Spaghetti and Meatballs. Yup, four regular sized meatballs. They, like the sausage had been saute'd prior to going in the sauce. Thick tomato sauce and instead of spaghetti We asked for capellini. It was a wonderful meal split between two kids and one dog. We did order a couple extra meatballs to insure all three were happy.

#4 Chicken Parmesan with Capellini. I ordered the extra chicken by checking the box when I ordered. There was enough chicken to feed a school of piraña. I ate until full and there is still enough for a lunch tomorrow. The salads that came with the dinner were cool, crisp, and eye appealing. The italian and the Balsamic dressings were perfect for the salads and with our meals.

Garlic knots, dried pepper flakes and cheese for sprinkling were supplied for us all.

This meal was absolutely perfect. We will be ordering here again, and again, and again.

Pizza Company 2275 E. Sunset, 89119.

We had a regional meeting and ordered pizza and salad... The food was very good and Joey (the owner) was so great...we had a large amount of people and I called last minute and added more to the order... They were very professional and everyone was happy. 
Thanks so much, we live all the way across town but we will be back.

My neighbor orders from them so I decided to try it for myself.  I was so disappointed after I spent $55.00 on an order. My mild  chicken wings though they looked amazing had no sauce at all and we're raw inside.  I ordered chicken fingers with BBQ sauce on the side they were drowning in sauce.  The Caesar salad was great but I ordered a Cobb salad and opened it to find only lettuce tomato cucumber strips and cheese??? 

So when I went online to get the number to call it said they were closed.  Hence why my order was prepared incorrectly they were trying to go home.  So since I work 12 hour shifts I was unable to call the following day but the next day I called as soon as they opened and asked for the manager who basically called me a liar.  

He said if something was wrong I would have called back asap.  I told him this was asap for me.  I work 12HR days and they were closed when I realized the problem.  He said someone would have been there after closing the cleaning crew was there...lol  So I told him I don't want anything from you but to let you know what my first and now last experience was like.  He said we'll you should have called before now.  I also added I put the problem on the survey I received from eat street the (site that takes the orders) an hour after delivery you can check for yourself.  He said he would check into it and get back to me.  It's been a week you think he called back?? 

Thanks for great service!! Il be sure to spend my hard earned dollars where it's appreciated in the future!

Having held off our review until we are now 3-4 visits in, we are sticking with our initial impression for this rating and review. We've had the thick Sicilian and the thin New York crust. We prefer the Sicilian. Toppings have always varied as have the appetizers. Have to withhold the 5th star for the mushrooms not being fresh. They use an excellent cheese selection,, especially the feta. Cheesy garlic bread was basic, but loved as it was a reminder of some made at home. Great flavor on their ranch. Props for using all home made dressings and sauces but give the marinara a little consideration for tweaking. More pepper/garlic perhaps.

Service has always been good. Joey is who I'm familiar with at the counter. He's always attentive and helpful. Willing to bake even up to the last minute before shut down! Clean and well lit seating area that I have never used. Casual but comfortable and respectable. Could bring family IN to eat and not get that super dive-y feel from the place. It is well kept. Can't rate the bathrooms since I've never used them.

I go to this place every time I come to Vegas. Great food, great prices and the people are great, especially the owner. I travel all over the western us, and I do not believe I have had a better slice in all of the West.

The vegan pizza here is fantastic. Daiya Cheese, fresh veggies and perfectly crispy crust. Can't forget to mention the vegan garlic knots!! Service is absolutely amazing as well. Best vegan pizza in Las Vegas.
The vegan pizza is excellent! Thanks Joey!!

If you want whole ingredients and delicious pizza, The Pizza Company should be your go to. I'm in love! All the ingredients are nice and even and the crust is bomb. You can't go wrong. Mmm... my belly is so happy. :)

First time here and it was as delicious as it sounds. Had the grilled chicken sandwich and side salad. Nice size chicken breast and doesn't taste processed. Italian salad dressing is house made. I'll be back again.

First this was delivered by Eatstreet. Quick,  foods always hot and the delivery guy is friendly. 
Pizza Company is near Sunset and Eastern. I live near Mountain Vista.  But quick delivery and hot food! 
The pizza; the sauce, the cheese, the meat the mushrooms are All tasty!  Usually on pizza something is not good. Here all is good!  The chicken fingers were big n meaty n moist and tasty.
Dessert, a cannoli covered in chocolate called a Larhe, Delicious!!! This was my 3rd time ordering and I haven't been disappointed yet.
An 2 topping pizza with 4 chicken fingers, chocolate cannoli,  liter of soda, and an extra ranch plus $5 tip cost me $35.84.  Its worth the money and then some.

On pictures notice the plate, napkins, parm-cheese,  red pepper flakes packages. The food comes in foil bowls with plastic lids so the food doesn't sweat or sog thru plastic containers. Ive got to go meet the owners cuz im impressed.

These pics are of wings and garlic knots. Yum yum
Best vegan pizza in vegas! All handmade and the best customer service! Been here several times and it NEVER disappoints.

I have been going to Pizza Company about once a week since this place has opened, and can say I have never been disappointed.  Location is very convienent to many airport hotels.  Menu is diverse, but find myself always coming back to the medium pepperoni.  The crust makes this pizza.  Crunchy on the edges and chewy in the center.  The owner Joey is ALWAYS friendly and welcoming when I walk through the door.  

Personal tip... Order pizza... Run down to the 7-11 for some beer and by the time you come back it'll be hot, fresh, and ready to go.  

A nice end of the day when you're away or at home.
100% best pizza in vegas. Love love love love this place! The owner is the nicest dude ever and super acommodating to vegans. Every employee is always super nice and great. Love this place!

I tried to order pizza here because they're highly recommended by the Homewood Suites but the guy hung up on me twice. When I tried calling back the third time he picked up the phone and set it down. We had a huge order of 10 pizzas for a party. He missed out on our business. I still have no idea why...
My favorite pizza in Las Vegas.  Also love the calzone and stromboli.  I'll be back soon.

Love this pizza! And they have VEGAN OPTIONS!  vegan garlic knots are bomb. Vegan ranch was bomb. Vegan pizza was bomb. Staff was also very sweet and hard working. Definitely will make this a regular when I'm craving pizza.

They really go above and beyond for their vegan customers which immediately earned them brownie points, or should I say pizza points? Haha!

I was immediately greeted by a man named Francisco, like San Francisco without the San (he really said that and I giggled). He was so incredibly nice, patient and informative about everything since I told him it was my first time there. 

Ordered $19.99 Vegan Special (Yup, everything below is 100% vegan):

* Hot, steamy garlic knots w/ marinara sauce 
* Medium pizza with three toppings
* Two sides of their homemade vegan ranch 

Pros:
+ Francisco was SO helpful! 
+ Fresh hot food, straight from the oven 
+ Garlic knots are orgasmic, seriously, I'm drooling thinking about them right now. 
+ They personally deliver up to five miles. They also offer delivery through Amazon restaurants and a few other services if the distance is longer than five miles. 

Cons: 
- Smaller place than I expected, not a ton of seating
- They use Daiya cheese, that's my only big complaint. I really wish they used something else for the pizza. However, they have homemade vegan ricotta cheese that was pretty good. Please toss the Daiya and opt in for something else, maybe Numu (New York company). 

Everything I listed above was insanely delicious it was kind of scary, because I wanted to eat everything in one sitting. Go ahead Pizza Company, just take all of my money now.

Considering I can't rate it on taste,  because it never arrived,  I rate it a one on customer service. I called at 8:26pm,  the person who took my order seemed hesitant,  I guess because they close at 9. However,  he took my order and told me it would take 24 minutes. Well it never showed up. No one tried called me and I called the restaurant multiple times. I'll never have the opportunity to try them,  they ruined the. experience for me.

This is going to be my new go-to for pizza!! I'm so excited I found a place that myself and my non vegan boyfriend can enjoy pizza together.

My boyfriend ordered a regular medium pizza with pepperoni. He absolutely loved it and ate all but 2 slices.

I ordered the vegan stromboli with black olives, mushrooms, and green peppers. I also got an order of the vegan garlic knots(!!!!!) with an extra marinara. The stromboli was delicious and the cheese was completely melted all the way through. Their marinara sauce was to die for. I enjoyed the garlic knots but they were kind of spongy. 

When we arrived the guy working the counter was really nice. He asked if we had been there before, which we had not. He gave us some coupons and insisted on giving me a free vegan ranch that they make in house. I personally never cared for ranch but it did taste really good! Definitely spot on as far as ranch flavor goes. He told me that they also do a vegan tiramisu that sells out really basically as soon as they make it.

It was a little pricey. Our meal cost us $26 but to me it was worth the price. 

We will be back very soon!

I tried this place out because of the positive reviews; huge mistake. This is the first time Yelp let me down.

First, the pizza. I ordered a Sicilian style with the Hawaiian toppings (pineapple, ham, bacon). The pizza was terrible! The crust was very odd. I don't know if it's their style or a problem with the dough but the dough had 2 layers. The top layer of dough wasn't cooked and the bottom layer was tough. The sauce had no flavor and neither did the cheese. The only thing with flavor on the pizza was the pineapple. This was hands down one of the worst pizza I've ever eaten. Frozen bargain brand pizza is better.

Next was dessert. They advertise tiramisu made fresh daily... My tiramisu was frozen! The entire center was ice! Much like the pizza the tiramisu had no flavor. The other problem was the cake on the bottom. The cake was dry and had a weird texture(felt like it was stale).

I highly recommend avoiding this place. The positive reviews must have been paid for because there is no way this place deserves a 4.5 star rating.

They have a Gluten-free crust.  It's an eight inch for $11.99. Yeah it's the price of a large pizza, but oh well.  It's nice and hot with a nice crispy crust and your choice of one topping.  Addition toppings are extra.  

I also ordered a medium Hawaiian pizza for the nieces and a large pepperoni with Jalapeños for the hungry husband.  Both looked great!

I fiiiinally got to try this place. This was my first time ordering take-out. I was so excited because as a Vegan it's difficult to find a good pizza place. I ordered the vegan pizza, vegan garlic knots and the vegan ranch dressing. Everything was excellent! The flavors mixed together were outstanding. The workers are very friendly and caring. I will definitely be back. This is my new favorite vegan pizza place.
Definitely a hole in the wall pizza place but so so SO GOOD!!! Their vegan options are amazing and do not make me miss the real thing at all! Their vegan garlic knots are TO DIE FOR!!!

Seriously, hands down the best place for pizza I've had yet. I thought I've had really good pizza before but this place just set the bar high for the competitors. Soft, garlic-y garlic knots. Delicious "the works" pizza with fresh meats and thin cut veggies (i love that) and you can TASTE the freshness and a to die for chicken alfredo. You can tell the sauce is made from scatch and real cream is used to make it. I'm happy I found this place and I will definitely make it my "go-to spot".

This is literally one of the best vegan pizza places I've ever had. The home made ranch is amazing. Every time I come to Vegas I will come here. Thank you for serving vegans and non vegans. Please come to California someday.

I reeeeeeaaaallllly love this place for all my pizza style-cheat day-dough-craving needs.

We order a 16" vegan with very light on the cheese, mushrooms, kalamata olives and fresh basil.  *disclosure* I can not stand Daiya cheese :) I just avoid the cheese when I ordering it and sometimes I leave it off all together.

We always order a full order of vegan garlic knots and WOW it's honestly my fav part because I love love love garlic, the more the better. Next time I order a pizza from here I need to get garlic on the pizza too :)

I will disclose that their sauce is a little bland...I think I'm just accustom to my own sauce that I simmer all day and use fresh herbs. I just like a punch of intense flavors and their sauce does not have that.

Their side salad it always fresh mixed greens and their in house balsamic is amazing. I always dip the pizza crust in it because it's just that yummy.

If you want pizza and you like a Slice of Vegas....(ick and overpriced) you will be hooked on the Pizza Company. It's just better. Hands down...it's better.

Oh and this place is a real deal! I think with we order all three items the total is $24? Wow what a steal.

My friend said their vegan pastas, rolls and other items are amazing. I'm just not that into ordering pasta when ordering out so I don't think I can see myself ordering the pasta.

Super happy with my experience here. Called in an order 10 minutes before closing expecting the employees to be unhappy.... Instead we had the pleasure of dealing with Joey who owns the place. He was extremely happy and pleased to help up. We ordered a large cheese pizza with a side of knots. The crust was cooked to perfection and the pizza was simply amazing. Not an ounce of grease on or under the pizza. The ranch was homemade and delicious. Nothing worse than a good pizza served with hidden valley ranch - not here!! I will definitely be back to this place to try some other options. They have vegan options for those interested. A++++ can't wait to eat again.
Vegan food is crazy delicious! And the sauce is top notch. Friendly people. We'll be back for sure!!!

Owner was friendly and food was awesome. The garlic knots was light and fluffy in the inside and crispy on the outside. I ordered the white pizza and was awesome, especially with the fresh basil on top.you can tell the owner ,Joey, really cares about his food and customers. The pizza crust was on point and tasty with thwur housemade ranch. This place is a little hidden,  so be careful not to miss it =).

The white pizza was the best I've ever had fresh basil amazing good new york-style pepperoni delicious thick sliced pepperoni crispy not too greasy very happy with this restaurant I would recommend it to all my friends
Tasty pizza, good value and good service. Don't overthink it, go to Pizza Company!

Surprised to find a place like this still around, food is brick oven cooked and of the seven times I've had it always made to my expectations. Good food, made in a reasonable time period with great customer service. What more could you ask of a pizza place. For pizza prices are a bit high but the quality and taste are worth the extra 1-2 dollars.

This was listed as 4.5 stars but definitely fell short. We had a combination pizza and all of the veggies seemed either canned or just not fresh. I've had frozen pizzas that have better flavor. The garlic bread was nothing special either and the chocolate cannoli was bland and we didn't eat it. The one positive was that the delivery guy was very polite. If you want good pizza, this is not the restaurant for you.

Food was decent for a corner pizza place. Garlic knots were not good, they were both burnt and chewy. The stromboli was made more as a calzone, so not what I expected. The calzone was amazing! Toppings were high quality, but I paid an extra dollar to have black olives and there weren't any to be found. Good flavor, but greasy. Delivery person couldn't find my address, very friendly and apologetic when he arrived.

No way this place gets 4 stars.  The best thing about this pizza is the price - and you get what you pay for.  We got a pepperoni and mushroom pizza and the pepperoni bites.  Both were bland and pretty tasteless.  Costco pizza is way better, heck a Digionos would blow this one away. Skip it and save your money.
Great prices for great pizza! We always order pizza and hot wings. I have also tried their garlic knots. Everything is super delicious and everyone that works here is so nice and friendly!

Had the groupon and had heard good things so I decided to give it a try.

Garlic knots are acceptable. Marinara is unremarkable. Pizza is disappointing.  The method used is blatantly the same as costco's, ball of dough squashed in a press.  Toppings are sparse and really there is just no flavour.

Service was friendly enough but yeah, skip it and go somewhere else.
Pizza was absolutely delicious!! Loved the crust! They have several vegan and vegetarian options. Very friendly owner and staff. Definitely will be back whenever I'm in town!
The pizza is excellent!! The owner is so friendly. The location is weird but my kids enjoyed watching the planes take off and land. We'll be coming here every time we are in Vegas. Ü

Just discovered this place, but apparently they've been around for 3 years here in Vegas.  Warm, friendly, attentive service.  Pizza was excellent - I had a slice of sausage and a slice of pepperoni on the lunch special.  Crust was crispy, sauce had flavor but no acidic bite, pepperoni and sausage were flavorful but not overpoweringly spicy.  Plenty of all toppings.  Good pizza with good flavor, no flavors or spices overpowered any others - harmonious.  Great under-$5 lunch at a local joint.

First off,  asked about specials and all I got was "We have Vegan this or that", which is awesome to have that option but not what I was looking for. So the struggle to have the answer for non-vegan special options was like pulling teeth. Whoever took our order over the phone had a very difficult time and asked 4+ times for the card info.  We asked multiple times for ranch and peppers,  even had it repeated back to us.  Pizza comes, no peppers, no cheese,  no ranch, etc. delivery guy didn't have a pen because "They don't give us pens" so had to search for that.  Pizza was bland,  MAYBE,  MAYBE one step up from cheap, generic,  frozen grocery store pizza.  Marinara wasn't much better... tomato sauce with some Italian seasoning?  Will never go back.

Pizza Company has been on my list for awhile now and I was finally able to try it last night as we were in the area on errands. 
I've heard rave reviews from a vegan group I follow, claiming they have great vegan options and even homemade vegan ranch (be still my heart!!).
I ordered the vegan Stromboli w mushrooms, bell pepp, and spinach and an order of garlic knots w marinara. The food was SO tasty!! And the service was so friendly and attentive. 
My daughter loved it, too. 
Will definitely be back to try more vegan options!

I have been to this establishment numerous times. I have tried their pizza compared to others and I keep going back. The crust is amazing, chewy on the inside and a little crunchy on the outside. Just how I adore it. Their pizza with only mushrooms is my go to favorite. I also like the buffalo chicken.  I have not had a bad pie here. Joey and Victor are always in a good mood, kidding around, having fun. They like what they do. The atmosphere is always uplifting.  So I will continue to drive the 15 miles from my house to the Pizza Company to get my fix.

Great pizza place! I always get pizza here. Always so good-love the cheeseness. Fresh ingredients, and nice people working. I also have had great pasta, and sandwiches and desserts in the past. The owner really puts care in his business-keep it goin! :)

My friend and I have been wanting to try this place for a while because of a Groupon I had and it is a good spot to watch the planes come in at sunset. We tried a little bit of everything. We ordered two medium pizzas one Margarita and a Hawaiian the crust was just perfect not thin or thick and crispy. The house salads were good with their homemade vinaigrette dressing. It just needed some more vegetables and less onions. The wings were nice and hot with lots of sauce as well as the garlic knots. The knots could of used more garlic, but don't let this discourage yourself from ordering them. I love garlic, so it is never too much. Over all the food was down to earth, the staff was accommodating, the place was clean, and the ladies bathroom was spotless. All this will have me returning again even though I live across town. It is just a simple pizza whole in the wall place with good food. Oh they just need an ice machine too for the cans of soft drinks or a fountain machine. All in good time!

Totally mediocre at best. we have tried it twice and its dry and laking in flavor. Maybe if your order the vegan option, its ok but if you want big, bold flavor...Try elsewhere. In a pizza town like this, we won't go back.

This place has the best vegan pizza in the entire city! I eat here very frequently and every experience is incredible and consistent. I would recommend this place to anyone that is looking for the best pizza place in Las Vegas!

Wow ordered 2 pizzas thinking with good reviews this would be a good spot! Oh how I was wrong! Worst pizza I've ever had I would have been better off going to little Caesars ! 
Very disappointed!!

I was looking for some vegan pizza delivery near me...looked it up on Postmates. I ordered vegan knots, side salad and a vegan pizza. So good. The cheese is daiya and I've heard a lot of people 
don't really like that kind but it is really delicious on this pizza! The pizza makers at Pizza Company made my order to perfection! The Postmates delivery guy was so cool. I will order from here again! Thank you!

It was our business's first time ordering with this company for lunch. We ended up ordering 3 pizzas : the white pizza, the works, and the spicy BBQ. The pizza was NOT GOOD at all. The chicken was extremely SALTY. The vegetables all tasted not fresh. The whole pizzas must have been sitting for awhile because they tasted old. For a first time customer this was not a good thing. So we called and talked to the owner Joey to let him know. All he said was "sorry but a company ordered the same thing u did and they loved it and our pizza is good so I don't know what you are saying." Our total came to $46 and I requested to be refunded $23 because of our experience. He said "I'm not gonna do that because our pizza is good." First off this is NOT how the owner of the company should handle a customer at all. You do not state over that it's good pizza and that another company loved it. Maybe they got the good pizza he was talking about but we didn't. Also as the OWNER NOT knowing how to handle a situation like this is unacceptable. He should've said sorry how can I fix it for you so that our company can be one that u recommend again. Instead he chose to argue and be rude! I would NEVER EVER EAT HERE AGAIN. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS GROSS PIZZA PLACE TO ANYONE EVER! The sad part is I never thought you could mess up pizza but Joey and the Pizza Company proved that they for sure can!

Pizza Company is a nice place to chill with friends and family. Right in front of the airport so you could see planes land while you eat. Vegan options are available which is why I come here. All the workers here are friendly and helpful. Also you can ask what their daily deals are.

This place is wicked awesome! I am from New York and am constantly on a good pizza hunt. I have been all over town and this place is in my top three. Add to it that I can't have milk/cheese as I'm allergic. Pizza Company has me covered! Their vegan pizza is to DIE for. They use Daiya cheese, which is a really well respected vegan alternative. My boyfriend and I also ordered the meatball sliders. Which were AMAZING. They come on sliced/toasted garlic knots. WHAT?! 

My boyfriend also ordered the spaghetti and meatballs. He kept commenting that it wasn't a dish he would order in a restaurant since we are italian and often make it at home, but the meatballs were so fantastic he just had to try this staple italian dish. The food was incredible.

Please come here. We want  this restaurant a long and healthy life. Joey, the owner, is a gem and deserves much success.

This place is REALLY good and has the BEST vegan options out there(we've tried almost all of them). Owner makes his own sauces with real whole-food ingredients along with many other things. Well worth the drive for us.
I had the veggie roll & it was delicious! Staying in a hotel close by & the delivery service was speedy & so polite! Thank you Pizza Company! Yummy!!

Best East Coast Pizza in Vegas by far! The service is fantastic, delivery is super quick and its easy to order online. Seriously order from this place, you wont be dissapointed!
Love,
The Jersey Girls

Ordered a 16" cheese pizza, BBQ wings, garlic knots (with marinara), and a cannoli for delivery tonight, no prior dining experience at Pizza Company. We completed our order online via Pizza Company's website-- they use "Eat Street" and the ordering process was simple. Once our order was submitted, they sent a verification email with a delivery estimate of 45-60 minutes. Our order arrived on time and everything was fresh- the pizza wasn't soggy or overly greasy, the wings were still crisp and the knots weren't soggy, either. I especially appreciate the sauce-to-cheese-to-bread ratio. We will definitely order from Pizza Company again (and when we do, I'll update my review).

THANK YOU to Pizza Company. It's very rare you find a takeout place that pays this close of attention. They noticed that my whole order was Vegan (vegan brownie, vegan bites) except that my order of a Greek salad with the feta. JUST TO MAKE SURE they made sure to put the feta cheese on the side and made the garlic knots vegan also after seeing my whole order with vegan options. This was extra initiative on their part. JEREMIAH (I'm assuming), the delivery guy, caught this.... It's great to see that they went that extra step for customer service! Thank you Pizza Company for being so awesome!
Ordered a Margherita pizza for delivery. Got it 45 minutes  and $28 later. $32 after tipping the driver. Yes, for one pizza that was average at best. I might as well get a pie on the strip!
Lots of vegetarian and vegan options with good fun service. Come here, eat food... Smile.

One star because it's food and it was delivered otherwise it would be no stars. Delivery guy was delightful and the food is way below average. Pizza crust was soggy and topped with not very fresh tasting ingredients, sauce was flat, garlic cheesy bread looked like my 10 year old made it and tasted like it too...and chocolate dipped cannoli had no taste in the chocolate or the filling- so much so me and my guest took one bite, and threw it out...and we really wanted to like it!! 
I don't know what else to say other than I have NO clue how this place gets 4.5 stars... If you have taste buds... Pick another place..

These idiots put this on my white car on a rainy day while I was at work. My guess is it was on there all day bc I didn't leave for lunch. It stained hot pink lines down my driver side door. Tried scrubbing w/ cleaner & it's still not all the way gone. Called & asked to speak to owner. When I explained what his genius employees did, he told me to go get a better paint job on my car & to call 9-1-1 for my emergency then hung up on me. Didn't apologize, didn't offer to pay for a detail, or even a free pizza. I got news buddy, if your putting menus on cars, you need business... which means you can't disrespect people & have bad customer service. You have some really bad karma coming to you. You should never disrespect people that way. Please do not eat here if you have any respect.

The Pizza Co. is a great little restaurant with excellent  customer service and delicious food! I stopped in after work and was greeted by 2 very friendly and outgoing owners. They made me feel really welcome  and comfortable right away. I ordered a small pizza and salad that were awesome. Everything tasted fresh and you can tell they use quality ingredients, I just wish the pizza had a little more cheese cause it was really good. The salad was made with fresh greens not iceberg lettuce and even came with garlic knots..yummy! They kept checking with me to make sure everything was good and even gave me  a couple  of cannolis for free because it was my first time there. The food was delicious and the service unusually excellent. We will definitely  be going back. If you want great quality pizza and great service, go to The Pizza Co.

Two words: garlic knots. So darn good. And the pizza was great too. They have Daiya cheese for vegans. Not to mention, the owner is a wonderful person, big smile, super-friendly and nice, hard worker.

I just happened to find this place when I needed pizza for some friends and was surprised to see that they had vegan options. Tonight I tried one of their vegan pizzas and it did not disappoint! I'm not a fan of store bought vegan cheese but with all the other great flavor, it was delicious. The owner was super sweet and definitely could tell he loved his business. So fairly priced and was very surprised how a vegan pizza wasn't much more than a regular pizza! Next time I really hope to try a pizza with a fresh mozzarella on it:) keep working on that recipe! Great small business and will definitely be back! Thank you!

Great many vegan options on the menu from pizza, pasta, garlic knots, rolls, burgers, and even a brownie!  Staff extremely friendly and knowledgeable.  Interior lacks finesse, but it's a pizza joint designed primarily for take-out/delivery.  Good food, good people!  Location easy to miss on first pass.

Excellent experience. The venue is not the biggest, but they make up for it with excellent vegan food and great service. Their omni options look cool too. The food is so exceptional because everything is fresh and hand crafted. We ordered the vegan bites (damn! they were delicious and when you dip them in the red sauce, wow "simply divine"), 2 house salads with vegan ranch (the freshest tomatoes and julienned purple onions! and the vegan ranch is some of the best we've ever tasted), and a small (6 slices) vegan pizza with pineapple, mushrooms, and purple onions. $30 very well spent. 

They had a few more vegan options, vegan Stromboli(?) and a vegan brownie. We're thinking about going back tomorrow to try those too.

Visiting from Napa CA we stayed at La Quinta Inn. Lady at the desk suggested Pizza Company around the corner. We shared small cheese pizza, chicken Parmesan sandwich and sausage and pepper rustica. All made from scratch and you can tell. Nice folks and great value. You will not go away hungry but will be smiling!

Decent pizza, super nice staff, I'd totally go back of I'm ever in the area! It was on the pricey side for pizza, but I understand that they aren't a huge franchise and probably can't keep the prices low. I appreciate small businesses.

Stunned at the high reviews. Called in for small 2 topping & told 15 minutes. Got there in 10 minutes & told it's going out in the oven now. I sat & waited, watching my pizza sit, while a couple phone orders came in. It finally gets put in the oven & I try pay for it so I could go when it was done. Nope, not gonna happen....keep making pizzas & when I tell you I want to pay now, tell me to hang on a minute. Then I finally pay & you take my burnt pizza out of the oven. Professional pizza making man, you knew my pizza was burnt & put it in a box & handed it to me. I almost drove back to give it to you & tell you that's pretty sh***y to give me a burnt pizza. It might have been ok if it wasn't burnt, but I won't be going back to see. Anyone caring about the food they are serving, wouldn't have served that pizza. Waste of my time & money.

Joey is awesome! Great good, friendly employees. Awesome lunches!!! Great prices! Joey always greets us with a smile and great conversation. Friendly atmosphere and perfect little hideaway. I always recommend when others ask where to go to Lunch.
great pizza. has deals for our apartment complex on wednesdays

So I haven't wrote a review on here in a LONNNNNNNGGGGG time (I'm talking like FOREVER, do you see how old my elite status is?). So let's call out that this food was so terrible I had to write one this instant. My roommate and I have ordered from all over the place in our little 89014 area. Joes Philly, Super Pizza, Napolis, and none were great, this one though, just bleh! They use some sorta seasoning on there that we couldn't get passed, one slice and trashed the large pizza. 

The fingers reminded me of something left out for hours and hours, put in the fridge, and then microwaved (I know what this is like because I do this often). Even though I do it, I don't want it to taste like that upon arrival! 

The cheesy fries, or FRIES I should just call them, lacked any more than 1oz of cheese and to top it off they were cold, bleh! 

Fried zucchini was meh, and so were the cannolis. 

The one good thing, and the reason why this has two stars and not was is the ranch! I'm a ranch connoisseur and I'm always searching, this is great, not vinegar based!  

Let me also mention I told the people I needed to break a hundred, yet they didn't communicate it with the driver. So it was pennies on then dollar on my WASTE of 50 bucks or I gathered quarters for him; which I did, because I used to be a driver myself and didn't want to be a jerk.  

You can see photos of this hot mess on EAT24 as well as my not happy comments. 

Overall- never, ever again Pizza Company!

Vegan pizza is hard to find and GOOD VEGAN PIZZA is even harder to find. & the Pizza Company has PHENOMENAL VEGAN PIZZA! The dough and the sauce and the cheese and the fresh veggies are extremely tasty! Also, the vegan garlic knots and the vegan baked ziti were also super yummy! So happy this place is down the street from me because I'm addicted!!!

We ordered the vegan pizza and it was absolutely wonderful!  We also had the vegan brownie (each vegan brownie order has two brownies in it!) and they were very good as well.  I liked the vegan brownie warmed up a bit.  I have to say that the people were very helpful and the service was very good.  While I live too far away for delivery, it is well worth the drive to pick up the pizza!  I am looking forward to trying other vegan options on the menu.  FINALLY! A place where my non-vegan friends and I can all eat and have good options.

Very mediocre food and bad service. We got there around 8:45PM and it looked like it was about to close. When we went to order (we were dining in), the guy taking our order seemed to act as if I weren't standing right there waiting to order. After he realized I wasn't going away, he reluctantly took my order. I got the all meat pizza with garlic knots and wings. Pizza was ok, mostly because the cheese and salami were good. The meatball was just awful and almost ruined the pizza. Only lots of ranch and crushed pepper saved this one from complete failure. Wings were good but nothing special that I couldn't make myself at home with a bag of frozen Tyson wings and a bottle of Frank's hot sauce. Last but DEFINITELY least, the knots were totally burnt on the bottom! The guys working in the back didn't even wait for us to finish leaving the building before turning off the lights. With that said, I highly recommend you do not eat at this place unless you already got the Groupon like I did... In which case, just get it to carry out because the service is unacceptable.

Omg omg! Is this pizza nervana? Cause I'm in heaven! I haven't had pizza from a real place since I been vegan. Well with all these options. How could I not stop! My belly is full. And happy. I had the vegan garlic knots and the vegan roll! Wich is a pizza burrito! Omg omg so tasty! I'm in complete shock. Service was incredible. They are busy. But I am patient! I'm off work. Now time for a nap! :)

Delicious! Very fresh and NON-greasy! I had a medium Margherita and medium Antipasti salad. They even threw in a couple of the very popular garlic knots to try. Yum!! Will def order from here again. Online ordering as well...perfect for lazy Sunday!

so to say this place is horrible is the least I could do... This place is a mess!
They have cockroaches big and small crawling all over the silverware so please beware what you eat with because that is so unsanitary. A couple of friends I work with got some coupons from them to get $5.00 complimentary meal. Second, they kept a girl I worked with's credit card on file... And charged her fifty dollars the day after she bought her food from there. Who does that? And on top of that they mess up your order and there are really rude. I would not recommend this place. How do you know you're not eating cockroach legs or shells in your pizza? Gross right?

I've been getting stuff from this joint maybe once or twice a month now over the past 3 months. The pizzas are still good (consistently) but I think their pastas are gross now. Chicken parmesan was a big miss with worst breaded flat chicken ever and their alfredo was wayyyyy too garlicky.

I love their chicken fingers and it's now my favorite thing to order.

I'm wondering how slow the business is because the ranch sauces I was given were  labeled "9/27" but it was definitely from 9/2 with the 7 added just today with a different pen. Not to mention it was pretty watery.
Absolutely wonderful Vegan items!!! The best Vegan Pizza, lots of flavor and the service was top of the line. I'll be back for more, I hope to try the stuffed Stomboli next visit.

Not bad. We went there while waiting to renew passport for our daughter. Food was pretty good, though not very fast (guess you can't be with fresh-made-from-scratch). Wings were tasty and the calamari was okay, but it was on greens which quickly got soggy and hence not very edible. (Don't recommend calamari to go...)

Their specialty seems to be delivery, but they do have places to sit (almost as if an after thought..."Hm. Guess we should put up a some tables and chairs to sit on...")

Guys were nice, but it seems that only one person takes orders and if he's on the phone, then you don't get helped. Kind of weird set up. Needs work on system for taking orders. They seem new at the restaurant business...

Food quality was good, but the "delivery" wasn't great (see comment about calamari above). Haven't tried pastas and such, but probably a good place to get food for football watching parties. Not a lot of sitting room for parties there.
Pizza Company is the best pizza I have had in Vegas so far. The owner is super friendly and the pizza speaks for itself. Highly recommend the buffalo chicken pizza

I honesty wish I had never found them.  
Seriously addicted!! Vegan options are AHmazing!!! The ranch dressing is ridiculously good!! Add that to your pizza don't forget a brownie and watch out waistline!! SO good!!!

Vegan pizza was good! It would have been better if I had ate it there instead of taking it home cuz it was a far drive. I was informed of a delivery service I could try next time so that was cool and helpful:) will definitely order again.

We were staying at the nearby Hampton Inn and needed a place to eat that didn't require a car.  Fortunately, Pizza Company was just 3 blocks away.  We ordered their "unlimited pizza" which lets you pick any or all of their toppings.  A good deal and the pizza was made entirely from scratch. Nice crispy crust and a generous helping of toppings.  It was served piping hot from the oven.  We also ordered their Greek salad and it was loaded with kalamata olives and feta cheese. The owner and his helper were really friendly too.  Definitely worth visiting again.

This place is awesome, ive tried several of their pizzas and all of them have been delicious. You must try the Garlic Fries, they were spectacular. The staff is super friendly, you really do get treated like family.  If you have a concern about the traffic, remember they deliver!

Read all the reviews on yelp, figured this place would be great. Nope not all. Maybe if your Vegan but I don't have my pizza that way. 

The shop could have been a lot cleaner. Had Junk laying around the back. 

The staff was friendly but felt rushed when making my order. 

Got a supreme pizza and salad. The pizza was alright tasting but nothing great at all. Had a pool of water/grease underneath it. Made the dough taste gross. Salad was nothing better then the bag kind you can buy at the store. My husband was fine but I did have a upset stomach all night afterwards. 

Not worth the 25 bucks for it.

We ordered delivery tonight and it was delicious! It came quick and hot-with some courtesy garlic knots thrown in for good measure (thank you for that!).

My spaghetti and meatballs was delicious. The balls were a good size and the sauce was mild and fresh tasting. 

The Big Guy got the double meat sandwich with no onions. He says he would get it with extra cheese next time, but he really enjoyed it with the french fries. 

The mushroom bites were also very tasty! We expected fried mushrooms, but it was cheese and pastry wrapped with mushrooms in them, dipped in marinara-yum!

Thank you for giving us another delivery option.
Ordered while at the Hampton Inn nearby using the app. Food was hot and tasty and all items were well packaged and accounted for. Delivery was friendly and fast. Would order here again.

I heard this place had a few Vegan options so I decided to try it out today, and I'm definitely glad I did! Very friendly staff, and the food was really great & fresh! We tried the Vegan GarlicKnots, the Vegan Baked Ziti, and a Vegan 3 topping pizza. All the food was awesome and we definitely plan to come back, it's always nice to find places with a good menu selection for Vegan, Vegetarian, or any plant based options. My only minor complaints might be that the food did take a while (about 45-60min) so don't dine in if you're in a hurry, but everything is obviously made fresh to order. It's not a glamours place by any means, but it's worth checking out. I will definitely be back and would recommend it to any Vegans looking for good Italian food.
Their Vegan pizza is so good that kids eat it!  My fam loves the garlic knots too.

We happened across this place, here on Yelp. When we pulled up it looked small and i thought we made a mistake. Nope, we ordered the Garlic Knots and a small All The Meats pizza. The garlic knots were so crispy on the outside and beautifully soft on the inside and I dipped  them in the marinara then the ranch and it was a heavenly experience! Then our pizza arrived and I did the same thing. We enjoyed every single bite we took! We can't wait to come back to try the meatball sliders!

This is the perfect locally owned pizza place with so many options! If you're like my family and have issues finding places that have a combination of regular food and vegan options- this is your place!!  The staff was incredibly nice and you could tell everything was actually house made- watched the chef hand toss the pizza dough and everything! Definitely would recommend this to your list of places to stop while in Vegas. I mean look at the size of that vegan Stromboli!

This place is amazing! I heard about the vegan special (one pizza with daiya vegan cheese and three toppings, vegan garlic knots and vegan ranch) and it's seriously the best. It was my first time in and the guy working let me try their homemade cashew based ricotta - I'm definitely ordering my pizza with that next time it's delicious! It's not on the menu but you can request it. The staff was super nice and great quality food I can't wait to go back!

These guys are awesome!! The ingredients they use is top notch! I have never had a greasy pizza or any problem at all.  Any thing you get from the pizzas to the appetizers are great! Thanks Joey your da man!!

We 3 ate here because it was walking distance from the Hampton Inn.  The manager was nice, and the pizza was average good.  The place was small and had a dive atmosphere.
The location is across the street from the airport, but not loud.
I'm giving it an extra * for being vegan friendly!

We stayed at a nearby hotel and awaited our morning flight, so stopped into Pizza Company for dinner.  They have a small seating area (and we were the only ones there - granted it was about 5 pm, but on a Friday).

The salads were good and about average size.  The three garlic knots were a nice addition - very tasty.

We ordered a double crust (which in my previous experiences meant "double thick" - here it meant crust on top as well.)  It was a bit crispy (maybe a TAD overdone) and I'd have liked to have had it stuffed with a bit more topping - sauce, toppings and cheese - but it all tasted very good.

The guys there at the pizza place were very nice and took care of us well (though, again, I get the feeling that they do mostly take out and delivery).

Ordered pizza and salad for a birthday party at kangamoo. It was delivered promptly and tasted delicious. We were a little nervous because we had never eaten there but our guests loved it and the dressings and salad were delish! Would definitely recommend this place. Thanks Joey!

Had a vegan pizza, vegan garlic knots, vegan cheesecake and a basket of fries and it was honestly one of the best pizza places I've been to. On top of that, I didn't feel like crap after eating all that food because you can tell that the food's been made fresh. 

The manager was very friendly and nice, and have excellent customer service. Will definitely be coming back to this place very soon.

Omg. Omg. Omg! I read the reviews and wow! So the location is weird and the inside is kind of ehhhhh but omg! The owner is ridiculously nice and there is an ENTIRE VEGAN MENU. We got the garlic knots, per everyone's suggestion and so glad I did. They found the perfect dough, or made it, rather. Also shared a vegan calzone - spinach, mushrooms, peppers, garlic, black olives, daiyafoods mozzarella in amazingly perfectly cooked crispy outside soft inside dough with ridiculously good marinara sauce for dipping. Also got a spinach, garlic, tomato vegan pie with daiyafoods mozzarella. 
There were so many options though so it was hard to make a decision but I'm so glad we got what we did. I'll definitely be back next time I'm in town. 

Reasonably priced and hefty portions.

Pretty good taste for, Steve's Pizza! Also, order a 12piece chicken. We were missing one but it's all good. We ordered for delivery and it came at an exceptional time. The 2-liter coke could've been colder for liking. Good ranch too! Would like to see more special for family type meals. Pizza/wings/drink combo.

Not bad at all. This is our first time here but we will be back. Glad to have a descent, local pizza place nearby. We had their spinach calzone, turkey club and buffalo chicken roll. I am anxious to try other stuff, especially their Vegan pizza. Atmosphere is a little make-shift but You should stop in and try it out. I think you'll be pleasantly surprised.

I can't believe I've gone this long without trying here! I was so eager to find more spots with vegan pizza, and this place popped up when I searched for vegan pizza on yelp. 

My friend and I stopped by on a Monday during lunch, and got a medium vegan pizza with garlic knots for $20. The garlic knots came out quick and fresh. The pizza followed shortly and was delicious. They even let us choose three veggies to put on top of it! Overall I was impressed by their vegan selection and their kind staff. I will definitely be back.

I've ordered from them a few times now, always delivery. The pizza and garlic knots are delicious, and the delivery is quick. I love that they have vegan options for my vegan friends, so there's something for everyone! The prices are good as well, and the people I talk to on the phone are always very nice. This is my go-to pizza place!

Tried this place for the vegan pizza. Initially our order came out wrong but Joey was so accommodating and gave us free vegan garlic knots while we waited. Everything we ordered was delicious and worth the wait. Vegan brownies were also delicious!

This is a great place to order from. The antipasto salad is awesome with lots of meat and cheese.  Best home made meatballs I have had.  Pizza and garlic knots are good.  I have also tried the eggplant parmesan.  The food is always Hot when it arrives.  I also love the service!!

Staff is very nice but pizza wasn't the best. Tasted like pizza bought from a grocery store. Everything was so over cooked. It made everything dry and hard. Some topping like the mushrooms looked and tasted like it was from a can. Asked about why everything is so over cooked and was told "that's the way it is." Wasn't offered a replacement pizza. Probably won't be back.

I'm still eating and writing this review... 

I travel a lot for work and prefer not to rent a car, so when I'm out, it's hard for me to find good places within a reasonable walking/cab distance. And I'm vegan... so it makes it double hard! When I saw that a pizza place offers a vegan option I was all about it. 

I ordered the vegan garlic knots and the vegan "roll"... holy cow. It's not bland, the flavors are great and the roll is so much food, it's too much to eat! 

Some reviews I've read said the crust isn't great, but on the roll, I was really impressed. 

Thanks Pizza Co.! You made a happy, full girl outta me!

Update 9/2015. I was back in Vegas for work and I called Pizza Co. I didn't have the menu in front of me but by my phone number they were able to pull my previous order. Talk about customer service! Also, I needed it delivered at a specific time and they were able to, even during the evening rush. Again, a satisfied, full girl!

Not only was the food amazing, the service was out of this world! My boyfriend and I are vegan and came down to vegas for life is beautiful, we met a local that happened to be vegan and she recommended we check this place out. She mentioned they had the best vegan pizza in vegas. Just like everyone else we go nuts for pizza and decide to check this place out before heading back to San Diego. We were so satisfied with the food and the service we ended up taking food for our family back home. 

All of their food is made from scratch, which is something most restaurants now a days do not offer! We ordered the vegan special which included a medium size pizza with 3 toppings, 6 garlic knots, and two vegan ranch (I've had my fair share of ranch this one by far was my favorite) all for about 19.99 plus tax. 

We never got the owners name but we are truly thankful for the great hospitality and excited to see what the future has to offer this amazing brand. 

Locals please support your local mom and pop restaurants, they have quality food unlike these fast food joints that serve you garbage!!!

Ordered delivery first time, super Glad i did the food was great and my burger was amazing my wife and i for the first time had no complaints about our delivered food. Definitely will order here again.

My husband is a cheese lover and I'm a vegan so sometimes it's hard to find a place that will satisfy us both. Pizza Company makes pizza night something we both look forward to. 

Their vegan pizza is comfort food for me and something I end up ordering on the regular.

I used to bring my own vegan ranch for dipping but recently the owner started making his own. It is SO GOOD. When I get pizzas for my office I will get extras of the vegan ranch and everyone, even the meat and dairy lovers, raves about how good it is.

The vegan brownies are seriously good too, better than even most vegan restaurants. My hubby who is not really into baked goods will even devour one by himself! 

Their cheesecake is yummy too and something I get cravings for. The vegan ziti is pretty good, not amazing but definitely will hit the spot if you're in the mood. 

Oh but the garlic knots  So good. You can tell they are so much better quality than any type of garlic bread or similar product you would get at a chain like papa Johns or dominos.

Speaking of which, they are a small business and the owner is very involved. He listens to his customers and does his best to offer the things we want. One of the ways he does this is by using the ingredients he thinks are best, even if it costs him substantially more than a similar ingredient would. He buys fresh spinach instead of frozen and brand name vegan products even if he can't get them at wholesale prices. Pretty awesome if you ask me.

Oo and sometimes they run specials on their vegan pizzas too!

Surprisingly good pizza!! 
The location is small and out of site but wow I was impressed with the quality of their pizza. 
The prices are reasonable too. I got the 2 slice + drink lunch special for $6 even. It wasn't until I threw away the box that I discovered they make all their sauces, dough, salads, etc from scratch!! (It's written on the box) No wonder it was so good! 

"I will be back" -Arnold Schwarzenegger

Love this little hole in the wall place. They have excellent tasting food, great service, and their prices reflect the quality of food you get. 

First time I came here I got the personal 10" veggie pizza. It was made on a thin crust, which I normally don't like as it tends to get soggy quickly and I end up having to eat it with a knife and fork, but theirs here was nice and crispy and stayed that way even the next day when I had leftovers!! Major points for that. The veggie pizza is made with spinach, green peppers, onions, mushrooms and black olives. All my favorite items on a veggie pizza. Cost $10.99.

The second time I came, I decided to try the Grilled chicken sandwich with bacon that came with a side. I decided on their fries. Another excellent item on their menu. The sandwich was on a ciabatta bun with lettuce, tomatoes, onions, and mayo. The bread was fresh tasting, the chicken was perfectly cooked yet still nice and moist, and all the toppings were nice and fresh and crispy as well. The fries were well cooked and seasoned perfectly. Cost $9.99.

They offer a nice selection of lunch specials during the week from 11 am to 3 pm Monday-Friday. All their lunch specials come with a drink. 

And for those that are Vegan, they offer vegan options as well. This is such a nice and thoughtful thing for this place to offer since many people are Vegan, but still want to enjoy food outside of their own house. 

On top of their excellent food, the employees here are super friendly and accommodating. They work hard to make sure your food is just the way you want it. They were very welcoming and make conversation with their customers. 

The inside is pretty small with about 5 tables, so not a great place to come if you have a large party of people. The inside is older looking but is kept clean and organized. 

Will be back!!!
Unoriginal, bland and boring.Review is for Joey, not the pie. Did not want to try after talking with this guy. Congratulations Joey!!! You are a 1 star human being. Off to Grimaldi's.

Awesome place-ordered pepperoni pizza and garlic knots, brownie, chef salad and 2 liter sprite was delivered well within the time frame even though it's a Saturday evening. Chef salad was large enough for dinner and lunch tomorrow - Brownies however didn't make it to top it off a courteous 
 delivery person. A great addition to family movie night, thanks
Absolutely fantastic Sicilian-style pizza. Pillowy thick inside and crunchy crust. Garlic knots are also great. Got it delivered and it was still fresh and hot, not soggy at all. Very pleased.

Great little hole-in-the-wall pizza joint.  Great lunch deals and pizza is New York style thin and tasty.  Love to put a little oregano on it and fold.

Check out the $1 slice Monday lunch special!

Amazing food and service. I ordered a pizza and wings for delivery. Wings were hot and crispy and delicious, pizza has a great amount of toppings and tastes fresh and arrived hot, the way pizza is supposed to be.

I called in my order and was helped by Joey. Friendly and even offered me an extra 10% off... I don't know why? Maybe because I was referred by the hotel or that I am here for work? Greatly appreciated and NOT forgotten. That is how you keep people coming back. Thank you!

I will order this pizza again, no doubt about that. Oh, and it was here within 30 minutes and arrived with plates, all the sauces I ordered, cheese and red peppers. 
Kudos!

The pizza was great, I ordered a alfredo chicken pizza and cheese garlic bread. I must say it's different from what I normally have in Chicago and it's definitely different than your favorite pizza chain. Everything seemed fresh and host was friendly enough, though a bit deserted on a weekend lunchtime, it's a small place, just enough for 20-25 people, but worth a try. And yes, the menu is pretty economical too.

I loved Pizza Company! It's great when a restaurant has clearly marked vegan options, my favorite was the vegan roll. The best part was the service, the owner and all the associates were very friendly and helpful and looked like they take pride in what they do and enjoy it. I feel like the location is not the best, which is why I gave it 4 stars instead of 5. A better location could help improve the atmosphere but overall great food and service!

This place was amazing! The service was really good and the worker was very helpful and even let us sample some of their house made vegan cheese to ensure that we would enjoy it. We didn't have to wait long before our garlic knots arrived and they were AMAZING! They came with a side of vegan ranch that was the best we've ever tasted (also made in house). Our favorite vegan pizza we've ever eaten and we're from Los Angeles. 

P.S. we recommend adding the vegan ricotta cheese to your pizza with onions, pineapples, and green peppers.

Don't judge this place by its curb appeal. Once you go in, don't judge it by the atmosphere.  The pizza is DELISH!!! Incredibly accommodating service and top notch pizza. Next time - I'm trying a sandwich.

Absolutely favorite vegan pizza spot and all of our non-vegan friends love the pizza here as well. Great people who work here make the experience even better. No other place has vegan pizza like this place!!!

Nice view of the planes taking off, and very nice people. I had the cheese and margarita selection and cannoli.  The pizza wasn't bad, but nothing I would crave. The cannoli shell was not super fresh tasting, not rancid or anything and just was a bit dense and lacked the crunch I normally like.  The filling was nice though.  The one extra special thing this place offers is a vegan pizza.

Another busy day at work called for a working lunch. One of my coworkers loves this spot so we picked this spot based on his recommendation. It didn't take them too long to prepare the food after we called it in. 

We ordered a Buffalo Chicken Pizza, Cheese Pizza, Chicken Fingers, and Garlic Knots. I typically don't care for chicken on pizza, but the Buffalo Chicken Pizza was a solid option. It had great flavor and nice heat that you'd expect from a dish with buffalo sauce. The Chicken Fingers were fine. The Garlic Knots were warm and buttery. I enjoyed those. The Buffalo Chicken Pizza was definitely the highlight of the items we ordered.

Pizza Company is terrific! We are the owners of Kangamoo Indoor Playground (a few blocks away from Pizza Company) and HIGHLY RECOMMEND Pizza Company to our patrons. Good Pizza -- My husband is from the East Coast and he's very picky about his pizzas and he really likes Pizza Company's New York Style Pizza,  Great Customer Service - Joe and his staff are wonderful, always friendly and service with a smile!  Pizza Company is the official Kangamoo Birthday Party Pizza Vendor for the kids parties and every customer has been very happy! Delivery is always PROMPT, as promise and PRICES are amazing! Keep up the great work Joe!
Food is good but customer service, and delivery is terrible. Total impolite people working there. I had to wait an hour and a half for my pizza and when I called I got major attitude.

I went here because a friend recommended the place. Using 90210 iZigg services we got the free small cheese pizza offer. Since I was on that end of town I figured why not try it out! I'm all about free! SInce the place smelled amazing when we walked in I decided to be a good customer and also order the garlic knots. I had to laugh when the owner said he would be making them fresh, did we mind waiting 10 or 15 minutes? FRESH GARLIC KNOTS? OK, force me to wait! 
The cheese pizza of course was finished before the knots, so we decided to sit there and eat it. Upon discovering just how YUMMY the pizza was I promptly went back to the counter and ordered a large pepperoni to go! No way was I going to drive nearly 30 miles back home and NOT have any pizza with me!
A gentleman came in while we were waiting for the large pie and he ordered a SLICE! I did not even notice that they sold pizza by the slice, but my daughter says that's because I am old and won't wear my glasses! ANYWAY!
He stood there eating his slice and when the owner asked if he would like to sit he said NO, I don't live anywhere near here and just come to eat this one slice! It's that good! (His words.) 

Well, of course that made me happy! I was sure I would be glad I took that large pizza home with me! I must confess, even the next day, reheated pizza was delicious!
The garlic knots could have used just a touch more gartlic for my taste and I didn't care for the marinara dipping sauce (too sweet) but the overall experience was worth it! 
Highly recommend this place to anyone on the south end of town. We did also enjoy watching the planes land since we are right across the street from McCarran's runway! 
I may not drive clear across the planet for this place, but anytime I am out south I will definitely stop in!

Oh and I almost forgot the prices were quite reasonable. Like I said earlier I am all about FREE and getting the large pepperoni for only $8.95 was a bargain!
BEST FOOD... I always go here it's amazing! Their prices are perfect too!!! If you do go here you will have to get a Cannoli!! Tastes like it is straight out of New York!
I never get to have vegan pizza fresh made and vegan knots and so many vegan options. I'm allergic to dairy and these guys were awesome. It was so good I wanted to lick the plate.

Been there once with hubby. We had vegan baked ziti and garden salad. It was very good and the staff was particularly pleasant.

Pros: 
+vegan options including vegan pizza, veggie burger, and vegan baked ziti
+reasonable prices 
+friendly staff

Cons:
-delivery zone must be small (we live close but aren't in the delivery zone)
-hole in the wall location, no place to take a client or date
-use paper plates, plastic forks, etc.

Three words: VEGAN GARLIC KNOTS. Yes, I would come back for that alone. The employees are also very accommodating for my party of 10. My side of the table opted for a the special, which was a relatively large pizza that came with about 12 garlic knots. These garlic knots are probably one of the most heavenly pieces of buttery, garlick-y bread that I have ever continuously plopped into my mouth despite its tongue-scorching temperature. It's that good. And for someone who eats a plant-based diet, I have truly missed pizza that isn't thin crust. Will definitely be coming back to Pizza Company!
Good pizza and outstanding service. These guys act like they own the place...maybe they do. Found them on yelp and glad I did. Decent price, good food and great service! Who could ask for more?

10/10 always . Vegan garlic knots and vegan pizza is divine . Always tastes authentic, and fresh. Another 10/10 is the home made ranch and marinara sauce . While it is a tad pricier than say pizza rev , you will not get this quality anywhere else . The owner is extremely nice and truly cares about what he is making . I would drive 30 minutes to place any day, in fact I did on Valentine's Day . Absolutely lurve !

Close to hotel we're staying at. Ate in first night. Small place, but good pizza and salads. Had take out 2nd night. Inexpensive good food and good service. Nothing fancy, but a great option for a hungry crew.

This place is pretty unbeatable for lunch. Their lunch specials range from $3.49 up to $5.99. Today, I picked up a serving of their Spaghetti and Sausage Link special for $3.99. You get a good amount of spaghetti with a whole sausage link--some of it is thinly sliced with the remainder still being in whole sausage form. It also came with a couple of garlic knots on the side.

The sauce wasn't mind-blowing, but it was tasty enough. The sausage was well-cooked and had good flavor. They put a ton of sauce in my serving. I almost wish it had less sauce (or more pasta on the side to eat with it). The garlic knots served as a nice vessel for the extra sauce that was left over.

Overall, while not the absolute best spaghetti meal I've ever had, the $4 price point is the kicker. The taste to price ratio works in their favor.

Minor Update: I went back the next day and got the same lunch special. Strangely enough, it tasted even better, though the sauce was definitely on the greasy side. In any case, this solidifies their 4-star rating for me.
Fantastic small hole in the wall pizza place. The staff is so nice and friendly, and the pizza is fantastic. Wife and I had the vegan pizza and it was soo much better than we imagined.

I was surprised to see that they had vegan options, I ordered 3 vegan burgers with fries and their vegan brownie. It was so good! I am glad that I found this little place. The food is so yummy! And the owner is really nice and helpful. I've been back 3 times and I love it! It has the small family business feeling and the owner is really nice. My whole family likes this place now too!

Everything about this business deserves 5 stars.  The food is delicious, the service is incredible and genuine.   The owner has a real passion for what he does and it shows.  This is a company I can truly feel good about supporting.

Thanks to all those who posted reviews. Since we're a stones throw away at the La Quinta, we thought we'd try pizza tonight.
We ordered the margarita and pepperoni pizzas along with a Greek salad. 
The margarita pizza was a bit lacking in flavor, we'd rate it 3* but the pepperoni pizza was great at 4 stars. The NY pizza crust was excellent, along with good pizza sauce. The pepperoni was very good quality, not your usual greasy kind like at the corporate chain pizzas like Domino's, or Costco. the salad was good, fresh and we got the balsamic dressing and that was 5*.
The two guys who were working, were very friendly and courteous-if only this was the norm and not extra ordinary.....it's a real joy to interact with people who love their jobs, it makes it a great experience, when it's food, it really adds to the enjoyment and you want to come back.
It sucks when the people are good but the food is not, or vice versa. 
But not at this pizza place....
The Pizza Company has an A+ in my book. Not only do they offer extraordinary tasting pizza, the owner(s) are accommodating and friendly. Thank you, Pizza Company! Las Vegas needs you.

Amazing vegan options. Vegan pizza, garlic knots, calzone, stromboli, sandwich, brownie, and more. I've only had their vegan pizza, but it really hits the spot. My non-vegan friend LOVED the brownie. (And he's extremely skeptical of vegan food).
